MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.LightGbmTrainers.LightGbm (ctx, label, features, weights, numLeaves, minDataPerLeaf, learningRate, numBoostRound, advancedSettings, onFit)

Docs.param: The number of leaves to use.
The minimal number of documents allowed in a leaf of the tree, out of the subsampled data.

A delegate that is called every time the method is called on the instance created out of this. This delegate will receive the linear model that was trained. Note that this action cannot change the result in any way; it is only a way for the caller to be informed about what was learnt.
Docs.summary: Predict a target using a tree binary classification model trained with the .
Docs.returns: The set of output columns including in order the predicted binary classification score (which will range from negative to positive infinity), the calibrated prediction (from 0 to 1), and the predicted label.

MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.LightGbmTrainers.LightGbm (ctx, label, features, weights, numLeaves, minDataPerLeaf, learningRate, numBoostRound, advancedSettings, onFit)

Docs.param: The multiclass classification context trainer object.
The number of leaves to use.
The minimal number of documents allowed in a leaf of the tree, out of the subsampled data.

A delegate to set more settings. The settings here will override the ones provided in the direct method signature, if both are present and have different values. The columns names, however need to be provided directly, not through the .

A delegate that is called every time the method is called on the instance created out of this. This delegate will receive the linear model that was trained. Note that this action cannot change the result in any way; it is only a way for the caller to be informed about what was learnt.
Docs.summary: Predict a target using a tree multiclass classification model trained with the .
Docs.returns: The set of output columns including in order the predicted per-class likelihoods (between 0 and 1, and summing up to 1), and the predicted label.

Docs.summary: Ranks a series of inputs based on their relevance, training a decision tree ranking model through the .
Docs.returns: The set of output columns including in order the predicted binary classification score (which will range from negative to positive infinity), the calibrated prediction (from 0 to 1), and the predicted label.
